result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad Douglass Verzella was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: It is the Court intention that the conditions  of proobation be the same conditions  for Extended Supervision if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Total amount of $7,864.97: $1,000.00 to be paid to Marshall Erecting Inc; remaining amount of $6,864.97 to be paid to Western National Mutual Insurance Company.  To be paid first before all costs, fees and surcharges.
*Hearing October 8, 2015 to determine additional restitution.
**10/8/2015  ordered in amount of $2,500.00 to be paid to Marshall Erecting.  Payments to Marshall Erecting to be paid first, before the restitution ordered to  Western National Mutual Insurance Company.

Pay all costs, fees, surcharges and restitution during period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
If revoked, all to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds/wages.

Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Defendant advised that as a convicted felon not to possess firearms; further advised of voting ineligibility.
Mental health evaluation.  Comply with any recommendwed treatment or counseling.   Court will allow the therapy defendant is already participating in to satisfy the Court's order.
No contact with Marshall Erecting Inc. or the premises of Marshall Erecting Inc.
Provide prescription medications to agent before filling the.
AODA assessment. Comply with any recommended treatment or counseling.  Maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
Forthwith.  May have release for work, the Day Reporting Center and vocational/education programming.
**10/8/2015  Court will authorize the maximum of 12 hours for work release.  Court will allow the defendant to travel to Chicago for work subject to approval by the House of Correction.

records.addlTxt: Defense counsel requested the defendant be allowed work release for 16 hours per day. The maximum hours allowed by the House of Correction for work release is 12 hours per day. Court will authorize the maximum of 12 hours for work release. Court will allow the defendant to travel to Chicago for work subject to approval by the House of Correction.

Defendant Chad Douglass Verzella in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for resitution hearing. Parties have reached a stipulation in this matter. Court ordered restitution in the amount of $2,500.00 be paid to Marshall Erecting. Restitution previously ordered remain the same. Restitution payments to Marshall Erecting to be paid FIRST before the restitution ordered to be paid to Western National Mutual Insurance Company.
Restitution costs worksheet received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Chad Douglass Verzella in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Defense counsel requested an adjournment of the sentencing date as the defendant is continuing to try to pay restitution. State does not object to an adjournment. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Victim Impact Statement with attached resitution worksheets received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Chad Douglass Verzella in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advised the Court that they have reached settlement in this case.  Plea hearing proceeds. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Defense counsel requested a sentencing date in August to allow defendant to have time to collect monies toward restitution; State did not object.  Court granted defense request.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55-A of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue and set the matter for sentencing before Branch 25.  The 7/29/15 jury trial date is vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chad Douglass Verzella in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised the Court that his client is requesting a trial date.  Court granted defense request.  Movant has until 6/15/15 to file any motions; response due by 6/30/15; reply due by 7/06/15.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are due within one (1) week of the final pretrial date.  Alibi notices are to be filed per statute.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense counsel requested that this case be calendared for 1:30 p.m. instead of 8:30 a.m.  State did not object.

Defendant Chad Douglass Verzella in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad Douglass Verzella in court with attorney Christina Balistreri for Mark A Pecora.  Deann Heard for appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chad Douglass Verzella in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared on behalf of DeAnn L. Heard for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was to have hired counsel by today's date; he indicated on the record that he will be retaining Attorney Mark Pecora and that he would go to Mr. Pecora's office after court today.  Court allowed one last adjournment, but ordered defendant to have counsel present for the next hearing which will be before Branch PE.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chad Douglass Verzella in court.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Thomas E. Harris appeared as a friend of the court.  Court reviewed documents provided by the Public Defender's Office and defendant.  Court ordered defendant to continue to make attempts to retain private counsel and declined to appoint Mr. Harris at this time at county expense.  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chad Douglass Verzella in court.  Kimberly Schoepp for Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant appears without counsel.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Same Bail.  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-25-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chad Douglass Verzella in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
